page.title: 16Working on the Mainland
page.content: {Gillian West writes -}My Dad used to work at Elliot's in Cowes but they had to close because not enough machinery was being bought. Now he has to travel to the mainland each day to John Brown in Portsmouth because there were no suitable jobs on the Island. Every day he drives 14 miles to Ryde, parks his car and catches the Hover- Craft to Southsea. Then he gets on his bike and rides to the office. A season ticket for a month on the Hovercraft costs about Â£40. The car journey takes 30 minutes and but the Hovercraft only takes 7 min to cross the Solent (4 miles). Sometimes my Dad has to go abroad to Germany, to Holland or to U.S.A. His job is buying special machines and he has to go to the factory where they are being made.
